title: 10 best fitness trackers and bands for under £50: Fitbit, Misfit, Jawbone and Tom Tom
text:
If you're on a mission to get fit , lose that extra holiday weight, or get your body back into the swing of exercise, a fitness tracker may be the answer - with its motivating voice, nutritional tips, and progress tracking to keep you focussed.
Whether you are on a run, snoozing on the sofa, or going up to bed, a tracker will count your steps and motivate you to make healthier choices , like swapping the bus for a 10-minute walk.
The best fitness trackers monitor your workouts and display progress and goals on the inbuilt screen or your smartphone/laptop. They're wrist-like devices, usually made of rubber, that you can keep on all day and night. Some are also waterproof.
What do they track? Calories burned, heart rate, pulse rate during exercise, and how long and well you sleep.
Here are 10 of the best for under £50 1. Misfit Flash, Wireless Activity and Sleep Tracker , £19.99
The versatile and waterproof Misfit Flash works with your smartphone to measure your activity and sleep.
Pushing a hidden central button on Flash will illuminate a cluster of glowing lights around the edge. These lights show you your progress in simple terms, with the aim to make each light shine by the end of the day.
You can sync your progress and set goals with an iOS or Android device through the free Misfit app. Battery life is up to 6 months.
2. Fitbit Zip Activity Tracker , £39.99
This touchscreen Fitbit tracker will keep check of your steps taken and distance covered, you can then view your progress on your smartphone or laptop wirelessly via Bluetooth.
If you really want to test your limits, you can challenge other users and create some friendly competition, it's also rainproof, sweat proof and splash proof so you've got no excuse not to get moving.
3. WeGo HYBRID Wristband Activity Tracker , £43.63
Wear your WeGo HYBRID 24-hours a day and track all your daily activities including sleep.
Features include bluetooth smart connectivity, silent vibrating alarm, double tap display scroll, time, 7-day memory and a rechargeable battery.
4. Garmin Vivofit Fitness Tracker, Slate , £49
Garmin’s Vivofit is a wearable fitness tracker that assesses your current activity levels and sleep patterns, and then assigns you a personalised daily goal.
Its LCD display shows how many steps you’ve taken, distance travelled, calories burned and time of day.
Vivofit stores all your activity data on your wrist, and with a touch of a button, it wirelessly syncs it to Garmin Connect, the online fitness community. At Garmin Connect you can see your progress, join online challenges and earn virtual badges to reward yourself for all of your hard work.
5. TOMTOM Heart Rate Monitor , £49.99
Use this TomTom Heart Rate Monitor to measure how hard you're working out, and how far you've got left. You'll be able to stay in your training zone as it allows you to speed up or slow down to maintain consistency.
It uses Bluetooth smart technology to connect with different devices, helping to maintain battery life and keep data monitoring more flexible.
6. Fitness & Activity Tracker by fitWaves , £49.99
This bluetooth wearable fitness tracker bracelet monitors your sleep and shows you how many calories you've burned off during your day.
The fitWaves Fitness & Activity Tracker provides a pedometer that keeps track of the steps you take every day, whether you're walking, running or jogging.
The wristband is connected via Bluetooth to any iPhone or Android phone, and the app lets you view and collect activity data for up to 15 days.
7. MISFIT Shine SH0JZ Activity Tracker - Storm , £19.99
The Misft Shine SH0JZ Activity Tracker helps you monitor how your body is performing while you're exercising, walking or even sleeping.
With its handy, comfortable wristwatch design, the Misft Shine SH0JZ provides you with motivational data 24/7. You'll be able to check up on a variety of body functions to improve the way you do things and enjoy a better quality of life.
Track the number of steps you take while walking every day to see how many calories you're burning. If you run, swim or cycle you can also check on distance covered.
8. Razer Nabu X Activity Tracker , £44.99
The Razer Nabu X offers a no-screen, no-fuss notification interface, instead, it vibrates when you get an incoming alert from your phone, and the LEDs light up in customizable colours.
It tracks your steps walked, hours sleps, distance travelled, calories burned and monitors your goals.
9. Jawbone UP MOVE Wireless Activity Sleep Tracker , £49.99
Track your daily steps, activities, sleeping patterns and more with the Jawbone Up Move. Tailored to you, the Jawbone's Smart Coach will give you personalised recommendations based on your activity, to maximise your fitness progress.
Choose from several vibrant colours, and match it to your own personal style.
10. MyKronoz ZeFit Bluetooth Activity Tracker , £32
ZeFit is a connected watchband that tells the time, tracks steps, distance traveled, calories burned and hours slept.
ZeFit features a single button and an OLED display to check your real-time activity at a glance. It wirelessly syncs your data to your smartphone via Bluetooth, or your laptop or Mac via a USB cable.
